website_summaries.verdict: Good-quality tree wrap that allows air to flow through it. Tree bark remains cool and healthy.
pros: A good value considering coverage area (3 inches by 50 feet)
Especially helpful for trees exposed to the harsh conditions of winter and summer
Thinner than some other tree wraps, but you can double-wrap if needed
cons: Biodegrades faster than some other tree wrap products

customer_reviews.title: Saved a tree!  Protected a maple that had been rutted by a deer this past fall.
customer_reviews.text: Saved a tree! We had a 1.5" thick maple that had been rutted by a deer this past fall. As soon as I saw the damage to the bark I wrapped the tree with this wrap and crossed my fingers that it would allow the remaining bark to reattach and that is would protect the remaining material. Fast forward to this spring and the tree is doing great. The wrap held up all winter and the deer apparently do not like rubbing on this wrap so no new damage.
customer_reviews.author: phenryiv1

customer_reviews.title: Bad product. Would never buy it again.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to protect the stems of young, newly transplanted trees. The material decomposed very quickly leaving the mainstems of the trees open to animal damage. I lost several young trees due to deer destroying the cambium layer that I had hoped to protect. The wrap literally lasted only a few weeks before it fell apart.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Winters

customer_reviews.title: I was very disappointed in this
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed in this. It was so thin it was hard to put on the tree without it ripping. It didn't last more than a month without wearing off.
customer_reviews.author: Gail S.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Hold Up
customer_reviews.text: Really disappointing. Easy to use for the most part, but it deteriorated really quickly. There were holes and tears within a month of use.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: No complaints
customer_reviews.text: Needed tree wrap to protect a tree trunk the deer decided to nibble on. This is a little thinner than other wraps I've used but I think it'll do well since I overlapped when wrapping the trunk.
customer_reviews.author: mrs_goatman

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The product did not hold up well facing Western sun on our tree that we used this on. Very thin product.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: Have never used a wrap before so did not know what to expect. Thought it would maybe be thicker, seems to be tough enough.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Burns

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work
customer_reviews.text: We put this on 5 ypung trees that were stressed from the Texas heat. The wrap totally disintegrated within a few weeks. I bought a different paper tree wrap that is much sturdier. Stay tuned to hear if we saved our pitiful trees.
customer_reviews.author: Texaspilot

customer_reviews.title: Did not Last
customer_reviews.text: Difficult to keep on the tree trunk. Did not hold-up over the winter.
customer_reviews.author: Jaeger

customer_reviews.title: Worked fine for about two months and then fell apart
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine for about two months and then fell apart. Might as well have put nothing on my trees as that.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald L Foley

customer_reviews.title: not recommended
customer_reviews.text: the tree wrap is so thin it dont hold up long after about 6 weeks it started coming apart and falling off the tree. I had to replace it with a stronger wrap.I would not recomend it .
customer_reviews.author: john wright

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Had a tree damaged by animals and so far so good. Tree is healthy and happy.
customer_reviews.author: Estevan J. Lujan

customer_reviews.title: Works great and a good size for a few smaller trees.
customer_reviews.text: Great for people with a few smaller trees who want to protect them during the winter in frigid climates.
customer_reviews.author: Brent

customer_reviews.title: looks good and easy to apply
customer_reviews.text: I was able to wrap 10 young tress. Very happy with it
customer_reviews.author: Bethencourt

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: So far..the tree is fine-- and the wrap is protecting the trunk
customer_reviews.author: Gail L. Irish

customer_reviews.title: Shredded by the sun!
customer_reviews.text: I wrapped 3 trees to protect the bark from the strong summer sun. I live in N. Utah. Within 6 weeks, the wrap on the south side of the tree had dissolved, shredded and fell off the tree. Definitely not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Groll

customer_reviews.title: Lasted less than 2 months
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this product on 7/13 and on 9/1 is is completely shredded and useless. Not worth the time to put it on a tree.
customer_reviews.author: Briteday

customer_reviews.title: Bought this tree wrap and within six weeks after wrapping ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this tree wrap and within six weeks after wrapping tree trunks, it has started to split and tear open. Now worth buying.
customer_reviews.author: bcw

customer_reviews.title: not good
customer_reviews.text: this is too thin and it just disintegrates. Just bad!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love this wrap for training and supporting plants
customer_reviews.text: I use this to tie all my plants. It is the best thing to tie plants to stakes or trellis. I like the dark color best - it also comes in tan. I tie plants and the plants grow over it and you cant see it. It is soft and strong. I dont use it as tree wrap for trunks. I use it on branches, vines, tomato bushes - pretty much anything that needs to be tied. It doesnt cut through because its wide. I think its basically landscaping cloth in smaller rolls.
customer_reviews.author: ross732

customer_reviews.title: This stuff deteriorates really quick, it lasted about 3-4 ...
customer_reviews.text: This stuff deteriorates really quick, it lasted about 3-4 months before I had to re-wrap because it just broke down.
customer_reviews.author: Average American

customer_reviews.title: good wrap
customer_reviews.text: the wraps have stayed very well without doing anything more than instruction given to secure it
customer_reviews.author: happy reader

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly Inflated price for ordinary product.
customer_reviews.text: I bought six of these for about 10 bucks. Now it is one for $7.45. It's ordinary tree wrap. Egregious price gouging on Amazon prime. How do they live with themselves?
customer_reviews.author: coleridge

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last long on Tree's
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 4 rolls of this Dalen Wrap thinking that because it was brown it would look better on the tree instead of the usual white color. It went on great and blended to the tree really good but after a month it fell apart and ended up just like a paper towel and fell all apart. Stay clear of this product as in my opinion it is not durable enough for what its made for. Total waste of money- Inferior product
customer_reviews.author: Dave Brigham

customer_reviews.title: Great, long lasting product.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I was especially happy to get the ecru/tan color. Almost invisible on vines and bushes.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great if you like tan tree wrap
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing wrong with this product except the picture is misleading. The picture shows black wrap but the product is tan. It looks like the tree has panty hose on!
customer_reviews.author: B. Winkler

customer_reviews.title: Does what it is intended for
customer_reviews.text: Wrap is very thin but does what it is intended to do which is to protect tree trunk from sun scald. You might want to wait for a calm day as the windy day I applied it made it a little hard to wrap.
customer_reviews.author: Tootie1947

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time
customer_reviews.text: I used this product to rewrap my fruit trees this spring, replacing the white wrap only because the trunks had grown and I didn't want to girdle them. A few months later I realized that this wrap has almost completely disintegrated (the 2 year old white I removed was like new) providing zero protection for the trees. The only wrap remaining on my trees is a shredded band under the stretchy green plant tape I used to secure the wrap at the top....otherwise entirely gone. I will have to purchase more white wrap to protect them for winter. A total waste of my time and money. Do yourself a favor and use a different product.
customer_reviews.author: Denni

product_meta.title: Dalen RAP15 Protective Tree Wrap
product_meta.description: Dalen gardener protective tree wrap allows for faster growing, healthier trees & protects against the extremes of winter & summer. May wrap-up to 5 trees depending on trunk size. Size: 3" X 50' For total tree trunk protection keeps trees safe from the extremes of winter & summer allows tree trunks to breathe for faster growing, healthier trees may wrap-up to 5 trees depending on trunk size.
feature_bullets: Protects against the extremes of winter
One roll is enough to wrap five trees
Allows tree trunks to breathe for faster growing, healthier trees
Also protects against the extremes of summer

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.7 out of 5 stars43 ratings3.7 out of 5 stars
